title: Banks braced for last dose of PPI pain after late surge in claims
text:
More than two million Britons joined a last-minute dash for PPI compensation this year, with a rush of complaints leaving banks "overwhelmed" in the run-up to an August deadline.

The City watchdog said there was a 34pc spike in payment protection insurance complaints in the first half of the year, piling fresh pressure on UK banks which are already expecting to shell out £50bn for the long-running mis-selling scandal – five times the cost of the London 2012 Olympics.

Analysts said the final cost of the debacle were unlikely to be announced just yet given the volume of claims UK banks are sifting through. Big banks are due to announce their third-quarter financial results later this month.
